wiki.content:
"Keep the Faith" is a song performed by American rock band Bon Jovi. The song was written by Jon Bon Jovi, Richie Sambora, and Desmond Child. It was released in 1992 as the lead single and title track from Bon Jovi's fifth studio album, Keep the Faith. It is characterised by its driving bass line and is a live staple for the band.
 
 "I Wish Everyday Could Be Like Christmas" appeared as a B-Side to the song in the US.
 
 In the United States, the song reached #1 on the Billboard Album Rock Tracks chart and peaked at #29 on the Billboard Hot 100. "Keep the Faith" reached #5 in the United Kingdom.
 
 It is a regular song at live shows by the band and is featured on the Live from London and The Crush Tour DVDs. When played live it features Jon Bon Jovi playing percussion.
 
 In 2009, Jon Bon Jovi released a new version of "Keep The Faith" with the Washington DC Youth Choir on the compilation album Oh Happy Day.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Keep the Faith" is a song performed by American rock band Bon Jovi. The song was written by Jon Bon Jovi, Richie Sambora, and Desmond Child. It was released in 1992 as the lead single and title track from Bon Jovi's fifth studio album, Keep the Faith. It is characterised by its driving bass line and is a live staple for the band.  "I Wish Everyday Could Be Like Christmas" appeared as a B-Side to the song in the US.  In the United States, the song reached #1 on the Billboard Album Rock Tracks chart and peaked at #29 on the Billboard Hot 100. "Keep the Faith" reached #5 in the United Kingdom.

track.name: Keep the Faith
comments: This intro remember me Sympathy for the Devil

"I've been walking in the footsteps of society's lies,I dont like what i see no more sometimes I wish I was blind, sometimes I wait forever to stand out in the rain,so no one sees me cryin' trying to wash away this pain"
Finally, the studio version comes up on the radio.... I was getting close to hitting the ban button!
I think that this might be their best. Amazing song.
We should hear the Crossroad version with this tag, not the unplugged :(
The best album of Bon Jovi!
Lord, you've got to keep the faith. <3
Don't you let your love turn to hate! ;D

"I don't like what I see no more, sometimes I wish that I was blind."
What a GREAT Song!! Still the best they ever did next to "Dry County". And still on the best album next to "These Days". The rest is silence (shit). ;-)
